newsitem.title: UK: UK grain futures close higher on currency.
newsitem.headline: UK grain futures close higher on currency.

text.p: UK grain futures closed higher on Tuesday supported by a weakening of the pound sterling against the mark.
Traders said, apart from currency there were no other factors in the market.
"The market has lost its way for the time being and is just tracking currency," said a trader.
Wheat futures closed 0.60 to 0.50 stg up after trading 179 lots.
Barley finished 0.50 to 0.25 stg higher on a turnover of 17 lots.
In Amsterdam milling wheat futures closed unchanged and tradeless.
Cash grain trading in the UK was again quiet with only one trade reported on the fob market when Nov feed wheat fetched 102 stg a tonne ex-east coast ports.
Traders said delivered business was slightly better...."but Monday was so bad that anything is an improvement," said one.
